intro: Helicteres andersonii, commonly known as the Anderson's helicteres, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in swamps and along riverbanks. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
